title: Configuración de ubicación
content:
Su guía para configurar ubicación en un sitio Web presente dos diferencias con lo que observé en la realidad y por tanto no me sirvió. https://support.mozilla.org/es/kb/firefox-comparte-mi-ubicacion-con-sitios-web

1. La primera imagen en la guía muestra un ícono en la caja de dirección (URL), junto al candado, desde el cual puedo permitir o negar el acceso a mi ubicación en ese sitio Web. Tal ícono no aparece en mi navegador. Asumo que, es posible solo aparezca para sitios registrados en "Ajustes" de configuración de Ubicación. 2. En este mismo espacio, no hay opción de registrar un sitio, solo de eliminarlos o cambiar su configuración. Parecen partir de que el sitio aparecerá en automático porque pidió usar tal permiso. En varios intentos jamás me apareció la pregunta por el permiso y no se registra el sitio... en otros navegadores sí me pregunta... habilité ventanas emergentes -pensando que pudiera ser el problema y nada...

Tuve que usar otro navegador

Espero sea útil para otros. Fernando EZ

title: Scrolling is broken in Firefox 110.01
content:
Problem Report:

Since updating to Firefox 110.01 recently scrolling will suddenly cease to function completely whether using a Magic Mouse, the up down arrow keys or dragging the scroll bar. Clicking below or above the scroll bar will still work to move it but is not a viable option or workaround.

Quitting Firefox and then restarting the browser will fix the problem 100% of the time but the issue will return several hours later.

iMac 3.7 GHz i5 - Radeon Pro 580X - 72GB Ram - Ventura 3.2.1

creator: CWCmail156

title: After updating to a new computer, Firefox doesn't work
content:
I updated from a Macbook Pro to a Macbook Air. Since then, Firefox doesn't work. I get the message:

HTTPS-Only Mode Alert Secure Site Not Available You've enabled HTTPS-Only Mode for enhanced security, and a HTTPS version of cbc.ca is not available. Learn More... What could be causing this? • Most likely, the website simply does not support HTTPS. • It's also possible that an attacker is involved. If you decide to visit the website, you should not enter any sensitive information like passwords, emails, or credit card details. If you continue, HTTPS-Only Mode will be turned off temporarily for this site. Continue to HTTP Site Go Back.

If I click on the Continue to HTTP Site button, I get this:

Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to www.cbc.ca. Peer's certificate has an invalid signature. Error code: SEC_ERROR_BAD_SIGNATURE • The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified. Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem."

I've looked on the Privacy and Security page but can't find anything relevant, and I've looked on the Mozilla Troubleshooting page, as well. I also deleted the app and redownloaded it. I'm not an advanced user, so it's probable I've missed something. Thank you for your help.
creator: rpram

title: Firefox Monitor
content: I received an email that Firefox Monitor found my email address in a breach called Eye4fraud. I don't recognize this company or website. I don't have an account with them. Why am I receiving notifications about this breach? There are several reasons why you might not recognize the company or breach name: The site may have changed names or been sold to a new company. It could be an old account you forgot about. Someone may have created an account for you. The breach may be a combolist. OK so what do I do? I don't have an account so I can't change my username or pwd b/c I don't have any w/ this company. What do you do when a company you never did business w/ got your email address and partial credit card info and lost it in a breach?

title: Zoom jumps from 80% to huge
content:
Zoom not working correctly

I'm unable to maximize a specific website (Craigslist state home pages) correctly by zooming. The page opens at 80% zoom, which is too small to read. If I use the mouse wheel or control +, the zoom indicates 90%, but it's so large that only a small part of the text on the page is visible, and 3/4 of the page is blank space. It looks more like 300% even though it says 90%.

I can open the page correctly in full screen using F11 or the double-headed arrow in the upper lefthand corner, but then I don't have access to the menu bar. Is this a problem with Firefox, my computer, or Craigslist? I don't have this problem with any sites except Craigslist home pages.

Solutions I've tried: Clicked on maximize in upper righthand corner; used mousewheel and F11 to change zoom; cleared all cookies and cache, opened in troubleshooting mode, selected "Zoom text only" (made it worse so I deselected it).

Thanks for your help! I use CL for job hunting so I'd like to solve this.

creator: john.milota

title: no se recupera ultima sesion
content:
Cuando cierro windows normalmente y apago la maquina -> firefox recupera sesion normalmente, sin problemas.

Pero cuando se corta la luz abruptamente y se apaga la maquina, algunas veces firefox no recupera las TABs q tenia, sino q recupera una sesion anterior. De cada 10 o 20 veces quizas, pasa una vez. No son tantas veces, pero es un problema perder las TABs con las q estaba trabajando.

Estoy usando ahora un plugin q se llama:: Tab session manager q sirve para hacer un respaldo de las TABs abiertas.

Lo q sucede es q si pasa X tiempo desde q hago ese respaldo, y se corta la sesion y la pierdo, pues habran TABs q he abierto, cambiado, cerrado, etc, q no estaran en el ultimo backup.

PREGUNTAS::

Alguna manera de acortar el tiempo q tarda firefox en guardar las TABs de sesion abierta?

Este respaldo nativo de firefox de TABs abiertas lo hace local y/o remoto con el nombre de usuario mozilla?

Gracias
creator: rafael8a

title: scroll bars cover website-widgets (check boxes) (110.0.1 64-Bit)
content:
scroll bars cover website-widgets (check boxes) (110.0.1 64-Bit)!! e.g., when trying to activate a checkbox at the right edge (Amazon, marking an item to cancel an order) that is not possible because the firefox scrollbar (right side) covers the Amazon checkbox, so it is impossible to mark it, and so the order cannot be cancelled!

This is an unacceptable malfunction!!

(OTOH, on MSEdge, the scrollbar sits to the right of the checkboxes without ever covering them, so it's obvious that this is specific Firefox malfunction!!!)

content:

The sync function seems to not be working either (unless I am using it wrong). Most were securely generated passwords. Not memorable ones.

I saw that refreshing would remove certain things like extensions, but it said it would keep bookmarks, passwords, etc. I have my booksmarks, just zero passwords. HELP!

I need them for work today. Can you assist please!?

Appreciated, Tyler

title: how to search the value of preferences in about:config page after Firefox 71?
content: In Firefox 71 and later version, Mozilla introduce a new about:config page style. In the new about:config page, the search bar can only match the name of preferences, but can't match the value of preferences. For example, when I type "https" in the search bar, The old about:config page can list all preferences with "https" in its name and value; but the new about:config page only list the preferences with "https" in its name. It makes user difficult to find the target preferences with specific value. Is there any method to find the target preferences with specific value?

I'm on Firefox 110.0.1 (64-bit) and running in troubleshoot mode. Under settings, I have "Portable Document Format (PDF)" configured to "Open in Firefox". Some PDF documents show up as blank for ~27 seconds, but show up immediately on Chrome.

title: Ancestry.com not working entirely with the latest update of Firefox browser
content: Just FYI... for the past few days, I've noticed that my Ancestry.com DNA Matches will not open in Firefox on multiple Windows computers. This function works fine in Chrome on the same computers. In Firefox, the rest of the Ancestry website works without problems. I can navigate to the DNA Matches page where it shows Paternal, Maternal, etc., but when I click on the "View Matches" button, only the header and footer information shows up on the resulting page -- no DNA match data appears. It's almost like the Javascript, or whatever they use, isn't firing. I tried texting Ancestry, and their automated response suggested downloading the latest version of Firefox. I've already done that (version 110.0.1 (64-bit)). I don't know if this problem belongs to you or if it's large enough for you to worry about, but it's annoying to me and I'll have to switch to another browser if this can't be resolved. I'd prefer to stay with Firefox. I didn't notice this problem until the past few days (or maybe a week) or so. I'm wondering if it's anything related to your latest update(s)? Thanks!
